verses.verse: The word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> came again unto me<WH559>, saying,
And thou<WH1121>, son of man<WH120>, take up<WH5375> a lamentation<WH7015> over Tyre<WH6865>;

and say<WH559> unto Tyre<WH6865>, O thou that dwellest<WH3427> at the entry<WH3997> of the sea<WH3220>, that art the merchant<WH7402> of the peoples<WH5971> unto many<WH7227> isles<WH339>, thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>: Thou<WH6865>, O Tyre, hast said<WH559>, I am perfect<WH3632> in beauty<WH3308>.
Thy borders<WH1366> are in the heart<WH3820> of the seas<WH3220>; thy builders<WH1129> have perfected<WH3634> thy beauty<WH3308>.
They have made<WH1129> all thy planks<WH3871> of fir-trees<WH1265> from Senir<WH8149>; they have taken<WH3947> a cedar<WH730> from Lebanon<WH3844> to make<WH6213> a mast for thee<WH8650>.

Of the oaks<WH437> of Bashan<WH1316> have they made<WH6213> thine oars<WH4880>; they have made<WH6213> thy benches<WH7175> of ivory<WH8127> inlaid<WH1323> in boxwood<WH839>, from the isles<WH339> of Kittim<WH3794>.

Of <WH4666> fine linen<WH8336> with broidered work<WH7553> from Egypt<WH4714> was thy sail<WH5251>, that it might be to thee for an ensign<WH8504>; blue and purple<WH713> from the isles<WH339> of Elishah<WH473> was thine awning<WH4374>.
The inhabitants<WH3427> of Sidon<WH6721> and Arvad<WH719> were thy rowers<WH7751>: thy wise<WH2450> men<WH6865>, O Tyre, were in thee<WH2259>, they were thy pilots.

The old<WH2205> men of Gebal<WH1380> and the wise<WH2450> men thereof were in thee thy calkers<WH919>: all the ships<WH591> of the sea<WH3220> with their mariners<WH4419> were in thee to deal<WH6148> in thy merchandise<WH4627>.

Persia <WH6539> and Lud<WH3865> and Put<WH6316> were in thine army<WH2428>, thy men<WH582> of war<WH4421>: they hanged<WH8518> the shield<WH4043> and helmet<WH3553> in thee<WH5414>; they set forth thy comeliness<WH1926>.

The men<WH1121> of Arvad<WH719> with thine army<WH2428> were upon thy walls<WH2346> round about<WH5439>, and valorous<WH1575> men were in thy towers<WH4026>; they hanged<WH8518> their shields<WH7982> upon thy walls<WH2346> round about<WH5439>; they have<WH3634> perfected<WH3634> thy beauty<WH3308>.

Tarshish <WH8659> was thy merchant<WH5503> by reason of the multitude<WH7230> of all kinds of riches<WH1952>; with silver<WH3701>, iron<WH1270>, tin<WH913>, and lead<WH5777>, they traded<WH5414> for thy wares<WH5801>.

Javan <WH3120>, Tubal<WH8422>, and Meshech<WH4902>, they were thy traffickers<WH7402>; they traded<WH5414> the persons<WH5315> of men<WH120> and vessels<WH3627> of brass<WH5178> for thy merchandise<WH4627>.
They of the house<WH1004> of Togarmah<WH8425> traded<WH5414> for thy wares with horses<WH5483> and war-horses<WH6571> and mules<WH6505>.

The men<WH1121> of Dedan<WH1719> were thy traffickers<WH7402>; many<WH7227> isles<WH339> were the mart<WH5506> of thy hand<WH3027>: they brought<WH7725> thee in exchange<WH814> horns<WH7161> of ivory<WH8127> and ebony<WH1894>.

Syria <WH758> was thy merchant<WH5503> by reason of the multitude<WH7230> of thy handiworks<WH4639>: they traded<WH5414> for thy wares<WH5801> with emeralds<WH5306>, purple<WH713>, and broidered work<WH7553>, and fine linen<WH948>, and coral<WH7215>, and rubies<WH3539>.

Judah <WH3063>, and the land<WH776> of Israel<WH3478>, they were thy traffickers<WH7402>: they traded<WH5414> for thy merchandise<WH4627> wheat<WH2406> of Minnith<WH4511>, and pannag<WH6436>, and honey<WH1706>, and oil<WH8081>, and balm<WH6875>.

Damascus <WH1834> was thy merchant<WH5503> for the multitude<WH7230> of thy handiworks<WH4639>, by reason of the multitude<WH7230> of all kinds of riches<WH1952>, with the wine<WH3196> of Helbon<WH2463>, and white<WH6713> wool<WH6785>.
Vedan <WH2051> and Javan<WH3120> traded<WH235> with yarn for<WH5414> thy wares<WH5801>: bright<WH6219> iron<WH1270>, cassia<WH6916>, and calamus<WH7070>, were among thy merchandise<WH4627>.
Dedan <WH1719> was thy trafficker<WH7402> in precious<WH2667> cloths<WH899> for riding<WH7396>.

Arabia <WH6152>, and all the princes<WH5387> of Kedar<WH6938>, they were the merchants<WH5503> of thy hand<WH3027>; in lambs<WH3733>, and rams<WH352>, and goats<WH6260>, in these were they thy merchants<WH5503>.

The traffickers<WH7402> of Sheba<WH7614> and Raamah<WH7484>, they were thy traffickers<WH7402>; they traded<WH5414> for thy wares<WH5801> with the chief<WH7218> of all spices<WH1314>, and with all precious<WH3368> stones<WH68>, and gold<WH2091>.
Haran <WH2771> and Canneh<WH3656> and Eden<WH5729>, the traffickers<WH7402> of Sheba<WH7614>, Asshur<WH804> and Chilmad<WH3638>, were thy traffickers<WH7402>.

These were thy traffickers<WH7402> in choice<WH4360> wares<WH1545>, in wrappings of blue<WH8504> and broidered work<WH7553>, and in chests<WH1595> of rich apparel<WH1264>, bound<WH2280> with cords<WH2256> and made of cedar<WH729>, among thy merchandise<WH4819>.

The ships<WH591> of Tarshish<WH8659> were thy caravans<WH7788> for thy merchandise<WH4627>: and thou wast replenished<WH4390>, and made very<WH3966> glorious<WH3513> in the heart<WH3820> of the seas<WH3220>.
Thy rowers<WH7751> have brought<WH935> thee into great<WH7227> waters<WH4325>: the east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> hath broken<WH7665> thee in the heart<WH3820> of the seas<WH3220>.

Thy riches<WH1952>, and thy wares<WH5801>, thy merchandise<WH4627>, thy mariners<WH4419>, and thy pilots<WH2259>, thy calkers<WH919>, and the dealers<WH6148> in thy merchandise<WH4627>, and all thy men<WH582> of war<WH4421>, that are in thee<WH6951>, with all thy company which is in the midst<WH8432> of thee<WH5307>, shall fall into the heart<WH3820> of the seas<WH3220> in the day<WH3117> of thy ruin<WH4658>.
At the sound<WH6963> of the cry<WH2201> of thy pilots<WH2259> the suburbs<WH4054> shall shake<WH7493>.

And all that handled<WH8610> the oar<WH4880>, the mariners<WH4419>, and all the pilots<WH2259> of the sea<WH3220>, shall come down<WH3381> from their ships<WH591>; they shall stand<WH5975> upon the land<WH776>,

and shall cause their voice<WH6963> to be heard<WH8085> over thee<WH2199>, and shall cry bitterly<WH4751>, and shall cast up<WH5927> dust<WH6083> upon their heads<WH7218>, they shall wallow<WH6428> themselves in the ashes<WH665>:

and they shall make<WH7144> themselves bald<WH7139> for thee<WH2296>, and gird them with sackcloth<WH8242>, and they shall weep<WH1058> for thee in bitterness<WH4751> of soul<WH5315> with bitter<WH4751> mourning<WH4553>.

And in their wailing<WH5204> they shall take up<WH5375> a lamentation<WH7015> for thee<WH6969>, and lament over thee<WH6865>, saying, Who is there like Tyre, like her that is brought to silence<WH1822> in the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>?

When thy wares<WH5801> went forth<WH3318> out of the seas<WH3220>, thou filledst<WH7646> many<WH7227> peoples<WH5971>; thou didst enrich<WH6238> the kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> with the multitude<WH7230> of thy riches<WH1952> and of thy merchandise<WH4627>.

In the time<WH6256> that thou wast broken<WH7665> by the seas<WH3220> in the depths<WH4615> of the waters<WH4325>, thy merchandise<WH4627> and all thy company<WH6951> did fall<WH5307> in the midst of thee<WH8432>.
All the inhabitants<WH3427> of the isles<WH339> are astonished<WH8074> at thee<WH4428>, and their kings are horribly<WH8178> afraid<WH8175>; they are troubled<WH7481> in their countenance<WH6440>.
The merchants<WH5503> among the peoples<WH5971> hiss<WH8319> at thee<WH1091>; thou art become a terror, and thou shalt nevermore have any being<WH5704>.
